result.execSummary:
The defendant Danielle M. Kalmus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Shall pay within 60 days or as in a payment plan set with the Clerk of Courts office
Shall undergo and follow through with any counseling and/or treatment as directed by agent
Shall not use or possess controlled substances without a legal prescription therefor;  Shall not use or possess drug paraphernalia
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

records.addlTxt:
(9:30) Defendant Danielle M. Kalmus in court, in custody with attorney Brian J. Smith.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. parties have rec'd revocation packet; Atty. Smith notes that 2 people are present to make a statement; Def.'s mother, Joanna Lavaque called, s/t; witness excused; Def.'s husband, Ryan Kalmus called, s/t; witness excused; State recomm. (155 days credit); Atty. Smith submits letter from Advocap for review; Atty. Smith heard on recomm.; Court notes that Def. does not get credit for time serving in FDL Co. case which is 7/7/16 to today's date; Court believes the only credit for this case is from 4/24/16 to 7/7/16 when Def. started serving the FDL Co. case sentence, 65 days credit; Atty. Smith revises recomm.; Def. heard; Court imposes sentence; Atty. Smith requests Def. be given a report in date; discussion held; Court notes Def. should send a request for furlough if needed; Def. remanded

* 5 mo. in DCJ w/H&Tr. cons. to sentence imposed in FDL Co.; Huber for employment, child care and treatment - 65 days presentence credit
* All fees have been paid
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 26, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Brian J. Smith appeared.  Atty Klomberg appears in court.  Atty Klomberg is requesting an adjournment.  Atty Smith heard and does not take a position.  Court grants the continuance.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 19, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 31, 2016 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Probation Intake Order

State of Wisconsin apprs by Atty Bob Barrington.  DEF, Danielle Kalmus apprs in person along with Atty Bradley Jansen.  Plea/Sentencing.  PQWOR filed/reviewed with DEF.  Charges/penalties reviewed.  Stip/Recomm filed.  DEF enters guilty plea.  State asks to rely on facts in criminal complant.  Atty Jansen stips.  Court finds factual basis.  Court finds plea was made FVKI and accepts plea.  Court finds DEF guilty.  No victim.  State heard/makes recomm.  Atty Jansen heard/makes recomm.  Court heard/follows joint recomm/orders:

W/H Sentence
18 Months Probation w/Conditions
Maintain Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances
Not to use W/O Valid Prescription
DNA Sample
AODA
Counseling and/or any Treatment recomm by Agent
Court Costs - to be paid to Dodge County Clerk of Courts
Hearing at 12-22-2015 10:00 am

Attorney Bradley J Jansen in court for Defendant Danielle M. Kalmus. Prosecuting Atty Robert G. Barrington appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Jansen heard, unable to contact Def. today, but has spoken to her w/i last 2 weeks, requests if a warrant it be stayed. Atty Barrington heard, requests warrant but not oppossed to a short stay. Ct. heard, authorizes warrant but stayed until 12/22 at 10:00 am.  Hearing scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Status conference at 12-09-2015 10:00 am

Order on Arraignment

Defendant Danielle M. Kalmus in court with attorney Bradley J Jansen.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 10 days mtns; stc set; bail con't.  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Arraignment at 08-26-2015 08:30 am

DEF shows, but not on caleddar.  Court will call case.  State of Wisconsin apprs by Kurt Klomberg.  DEF, Danielle Kalmus apprs in person w/o coun.  Court heard/informs DEF of appointed Atty, Bradley Jansen.  Court gives DEF order with information.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

9:09 - Defendant, Danielle M. Kalmus in court, Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $1000 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Review hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:15 am.
